meanings.definition: Having a high-pitched and piercing sound.
meanings.sent1: The shriller alarm woke me up early in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The shriller whistle could be heard from far away.
meanings.sent3: The shriller bird outside my window seemed to be in a singing competition.
meanings.sent4: Her shriller laughter echoed through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The shriller scream made everyone stop in their tracks.

meanings.definition: To make a high-pitched and piercing sound.
meanings.sent1: The kettle began to shriller as the water boiled.
meanings.sent2: The cat shriller when it saw a mouse in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The old car engine shriller as it struggled to start.
meanings.sent4: His voice shriller over the noise of the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The wind shriller through the trees on a stormy night.
